required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of 3 Different Density Levobupivacaine Solutions + Fentanyl for Spinal Anaesthesia for Caesarean Delivery.
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Efficacy of 3 Different Density Levobupivacaine Solutions + Fentanyl Applied Intrathecally for Spinal Anesthesia in Caesarean Delivery.

brief_summary.textblock: The investigator's aim is to compare the efficacy of 3 levobupivacaine solutions with different density on spinal anesthesia for caesarean delivery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients scheduled for elective caesarean delivery were separated into 4 groups. Spinal anesthesia was performed with one of the following regimens.
Group 1: Levobupivacaine 8 mg + 20 mcg Fentanyl Group 2: Levobupivacaine 8 mg + 20 mcg Fentanyl + 40 mg Dextrose Group 3: Levobupivacaine 8 mg + 20 mcg Fentanyl + 60 mg Dextrose Group 4: Levobupivacaine 8 mg + 20 mcg Fentanyl + 80 mg Dextrose After anesthesia induction motor block was evaluated via bromage scale and sensory block via pinprick test every 3 minutes for the first 15 minutes, and every 5 minutes up to 60 minutes. Maximum sensory block level, time to reach maximum block level, time needed to achieve T10 sensory level were recorded.
Baby delivery time, and operation duration were also recorded. Time to two segment regression of maximum sensory block, motor block recovery time and time to S2 regression of sensory block will be recorded.
Hemodynamic data, nausea vomiting, were also recorded throughout surgery at the same evaluation periods and postoperative period.
The surgeon will also evaluate the abdominal relaxation surgical block quality as good, medium and poor.
The patient will evaluate spinal block analgesia quality as good, medium or poor.
Pain scores are going to be evaluated by VAS at the beginning, uterine incision and during abdominal closure. Time for first analgesic requirement and postoperative pain is also going to be evaluated by VAS.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of time to reach T10 sensory spinal block level at intraoperative period by pinprick test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 minutes for 15 minutes and every 5 minutes afterwards up to 60 minutes after induction of spinal anesthesia.In these evaluation periods, the sensory block will be recorded when the T10 is detected.
primary_outcome.description: time to reach T10 sensory block by pinprick test

the intensity of spinal block will be evaluated via questioning the surgeon and the patient. the surgeon will grade the abdominal relaxivity as good, medium or poor The patient will evaluate spinal block analgesia quality as good, medium or poor.

primary_outcome.measure: Change the sensory block level at intraoperative period by pinprick test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 minutes for 15 minutes and every 5 minutes afterwards up to 60 minutes after induction of spinal anesthesia. The highest measured level by pinprick test be recorded
primary_outcome.description: the level of maximum sensory block by pinprick test

primary_outcome.measure: time to reach maximum level of sensory block at intraoperative period by pinprick test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 minutes for 15 minutes and every 5 minutes afterwards up to 60 minutes after induction of spinal anesthesia. the time to reach the highest measured by pinprick test will be recorded.
primary_outcome.description: time to reach maximum level of sensory block by pinprick test

primary_outcome.measure: Change over time at the level of sensory block at intraoperative period by pinprick test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 minutes for 15 minutes and every 5 minutes afterwards up to 60 minutes after induction of spinal anesthesia. The time to two segment regression of maximum sensory block by pinprick test will be recorded.
primary_outcome.description: time to two segment regression of maximum sensory block by pinprick test

primary_outcome.measure: Change in motor block level from PACU to discharge
primary_outcome.time_frame: every 15 minutes until end of surgery and 30 minutes postoperatively up to 2 hours by Bromage Scale
primary_outcome.description: motor block recovery time by bromage scale

primary_outcome.measure: Change to regression of sensory block by pinprick test
primary_outcome.time_frame: In the postoperative period, changes in sensory block level will be recorded at 30 min intervals up to 2 hours
primary_outcome.description: time to S2 regression of sensory block by pinprick test

secondary_outcome.measure: Haemodynamic evaluation by mmHg for systolic , diastolic and mean arterial blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 minutes for 15 minutes and every 5 minutes afterwards up to 60 minutes after induction of spinal anesthesia. every 30 minutes up to 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: measurement of systolic , diastolic and mean arterial blood pressure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with postoperative complications ( head ache, back pain, numbness of lower extremity )by phone
secondary_outcome.description: postoperative complications ( head ache, back pain, numbness of lower extremity )by phone

secondary_outcome.measure: evaluation of umbilical vein blood gas analysis
secondary_outcome.description: umbilical vein blood sample will be obtained immediately after delivery of the fetus and will a blood gas analysis will be performed

arm_group.description: Levobupivacaine 8 mg (Chirocaine (% 0.5)) + 20 mcg fentanyl Chirocaine Plain
Levobupivacaine 8 mg (Chirocaine % 0,75) + 20 mcg fentanyl + dextrose 40 Chirocaine Heavy 40
Levobupivacaine 8 mg (Chirocaine % 0,75) + 20 mcg fentanyl + dextrose 60 Chirocaine Heavy 60
Levobupivacaine 8 mg (Chirocaine % 0,75) + 20 mcg fentanyl + dextrose 80 Chirocaine Heavy 80

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I-II
- Pregnancy at Term
- Scheduled for elective caesarean delivery
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindication for spinal anesthesia
- drug allergy
- pregnancy related disorders (hypertension, placenta previa, fetal problems)

overall_official.affiliation: Balikesir University School of Medicine Department of Anesthesia and Reanimation
